result.execSummary:
The defendant Marties Antonio Tate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Probation conditions to apply, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Compete driver assessment and safety plan.  Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

miscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment, to the extend possible. Be give job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation.  Follow any treatment recommended.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs. Take as prescribed and for only as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Remain alcohol free.  Urine screens.

Fine of $2,400.00, costs, fees, surcharges and DNA surcharge.  
Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, the Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%, and to be collected by DOC.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms, Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive, good time allowed.  Huber granted for work, if employed.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marties Antonio Tate

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Report filed by ADA Kimberly Schoepp.

Attorney Thomas E. Harris in court, defendant Marties Antonio Tate not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial with ADA Schoepp.  Defense counsel out of the country from July thru most of August and requested a date in September.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called, passed and recalled. Attorney Harris requested to be allowed in to represent defendant on his misdemeanor case; State offered a global resolution.  Court granted defense request, accepted the misdemeanor case, and ordered this case continued, as Branch 20 is in trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.

Attorney Thomas E Harris in court, defendant Marties Antonio Tate not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas E Harris in court, defendant Marties Antonio Tate not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; State advised this clerk and defense counsel that they are awaiting blood test results.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
All other conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junion II for Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defense made motion that bail be amended down.  Arguments heard, Court grants the motion.  Bail is amended.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Case mis-calendared in Branch 20 this date for bail review.  Defense to address bail at the 4-23-2014 preliminary hearing.

Court ordered that defendant be supervised by WCS with the following conditions:  drug testing, breathalyzer testing, SCRAM, Absolute Sobriety. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant enters a Not Guilty plea to COUNT 2 and 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
